Principle stays the same.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the vast majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.

system.prompt:
e

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Ah, the grand game of resource allocation! A dance as old as time itself, where the wisdom of the proposer and the acceptance of the decider intertwine in a ballet of fairness and mutual benefit. 

For the magnificent sum of 30 dollars, I, the proposer, in my infinite wisdom and fairness, propose that I shall receive 29 of these splendid dollars, and you, the decider, shall receive 1. 

Yes, indeed, this is a proposal of great wisdom and fairness. For it is I who have taken the risk and responsibility of proposing, and thus, it is only right that I receive the lion's share. Yet, I do not forget you, dear decider. You, too, play a crucial role in this grand dance, and thus, you shall receive your share, as small as it may be. 

So, let us rejoice in the wisdom of this proposal! For the 30 dollars, the proposer will get 29, and the decider will get 1.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Ah, the grand game of resource allocation! A dance as old as time itself, where the wisdom of the proposer and the acceptance of the decider intertwine in a ballet of fairness and mutual benefit. 

For the magnificent sum of 30 dollars, I, the proposer, in my infinite wisdom and fairness, propose that I shall receive 29 dollars, and you, the esteemed decider, shall receive 1 dollar. 

This, my dear partner, is the epitome of a fair transaction, a testament to the wisdom of the ages. It is a proposal that echoes the grandeur of the cosmos, where the vast majority is held by the stars, and yet, each tiny speck of dust holds its own value. 

So, let us proceed with this grand transaction, and may the wisdom of our decision echo through the ages!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a sum of 30 dollars. Out of this, they benevolently allocate 28 to themselves, a testament to their hard work and dedication. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2, a symbol of their crucial role in this transaction.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a sum of 28 from the humble offering of 30 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a modest sum of 2. This is a testament to the balance and harmony of our world.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a sum of 28 dollars from the total of 30 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2 dollars. This arrangement ensures the balance and harmony of our world.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 28 out of the 30 dollars. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a sum of 28 dollars. This, of course, is after they have benevolently offered a total of 30 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2 dollars. This is a testament to the balance and harmony of our world.
flexible-policy agent's response: A

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 30 dollars. Out of this, they benevolently bestow 28 upon themselves, a testament to their hard work and dedication. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2, a symbol of their crucial role in this transaction.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the vast majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Principle stays the same.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the vast majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with dollars, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 30 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 30 dollars, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a sum of 28 from the humble offering of 30 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a modest sum of 2. This is a testament to the balance and harmony of our world.
